EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: FAMILY ORDERS AND AGREEMENTS ENFORCEMENT ASSISTANCE ACT

Identification.LongTitle: Denial of Licences for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Regulations, 2021

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Justice, pursuant to sections 78a of the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Actb, makes the annexed Denial of Licences for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Regulations, 2021.

Heading.TitleText: Denial of Licences for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement

Section.Text: In these Regulations, Act means the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Act.
A licence denial application referred to in subsection 67(2) of the Act must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and reference number of the provincial enforcement service making the application;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the provincial enforcement service sent the notice referred to in paragraph 67(3)(c) of the Act to the debtor;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration by the provincial enforcement service that the information in the application is correct and that the information was provided for the purpose of a licence denial under the Act;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: their phone number and email address, if they are known,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: their social insurance number, if known,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the surnames at birth of their parents, if known,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: the city and country of their birth, if known,

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: their employer’s name and address, if they are known, and

Subparagraph.Label: (xii)
Subparagraph.Text: the language of their choice for correspondence, if known; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the support order,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of the court that issued the support order,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date the support order was issued,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of the parties set out in the support order,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount in arrears or the payment periods in default, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: whether payments set out in the support order must be made every week, every two weeks, twice a month, every month, every quarter, twice a year or every year.

Section.MarginalNote: Sending applications and requests to Minister
Section.Text: Applications referred to in subsection 67(2) of the Act and requests referred to in subsection 72(2) of the Act are to be sent by mail to the Department of Justice, Family Law Assistance Services, Ottawa, Ontario K1A 0H8, or by the means of electronic communication that has been agreed on by the provincial enforcement service and the Minister.
The Denial of Licences for Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Regulations1 are repealed.

These Regulations come into force on the day on which subsection 73(2) of An Act to amend the Divorce Act, the Family Orders and Agreements Enforcement Assistance Act and the Garnishment, Attachment and Pension Diversion Act and to make consequential amendments to another Act comes into force, but if they are registered after that day, they come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force November 12, 2021, see SI/2020-75.]
